publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-640 Christine Grahame: Boycottâ€”That the Parliament considers that the boycott by the Scottish Executive of the debate on Thursday 20 November 2003 on the subject of world peace demonstrated a considered contempt for the Parliament and democratic debate, particularly given the history of Labour in supporting the war in Iraq without a UN mandate specifically authorising such action, and therefore calls on the First Minister to apologise to the Chamber for this behaviour. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Campbell Martin*, Brian Adam*, Shiona Baird*, Linda Fabiani*, Eleanor Scott*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Carolyn Leckie*, Rob Gibson*

S2M-640 Christine Grahame: Boycott-That the Parliament considers that the boycott by the Scottish Executive of the debate on Thursday 20 November 2003 on the subject of world peace demonstrated a considered contempt for the Parliament and democratic debate, particularly given the history of Labour in supporting the war in Iraq without a UN mandate specifically authorising such action, and therefore calls on the First Minister to apologise to the Chamber for this behaviour. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop, Michael Matheson, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Campbell Martin, Brian Adam, Shiona Baird, Linda Fabiani, Eleanor Scott, Nicola Sturgeon, Carolyn Leckie, Rob Gibson, Patrick Harvie*, Richard Lochhead*, Chris Ballance*, Margo MacDonald*, Frances Curran*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-640 Boycott (lodged on 20 November 2003) Mark Ballard*
S2M-640 Boycott (lodged on 20 November 2003) Mr Bruce McFee*, Alex Neil*
S2M-640 Boycott (lodged on 20 November 2003) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-640 Boycott (lodged on 20 November 2003) Alasdair Morgan*
S2M-640 Boycott (lodged on 20 November 2003) Rosie Kane*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-640 Boycott (lodged on 20 November 2003) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
